Big_Bear_Scot

Well, here we go again! Three white cops, a black suspect, and a video camera. And oh yes! An apparent beating! Haven't we been here before? Your thoughts.
 
 
 Can you post a link ? 
 
 I am unaware of the incident(outside of the US).
lord tammerlain

I believe New Orleans police beat up a 64 year old Black man who was publically intoxicated.
 
 Here is the link
 
 http://www.japantoday.com/e/?content=news&cat=8&id=351740
 
 
Three New Orleans police officers filmed beating a 64-year-old man during a weekend arrest in the city's French Quarter were suspended and arrested on Monday.
 
 Graphic footage of the brutal beating, aired on television, showed two white officers punching the African-American man while detaining him late Saturday. 
 
 The film later showed the man lying on the ground, his arms restrained behind him, his face and shirt covered in blood on a Bourbon Street sidewalk
 
 snip
 
 The beating victim, who was hospitalized and later released, was charged with public drunkenness, resisting arrest and assaulting a police officer. The man did not appear to struggle in the taped portion of the clash with police.
 
 Riley cautioned against a rush to judgment however, saying that unseen factors may have been in play during the confrontation.
 
 The officers allegedly also clashed with the camera man who filmed the incident.
 
 As officers pounded the beating victim, a mounted police officer appears to maneuver his horse to block the camera shot.

How historically deficient are you? Remember the LA Riots of 1992? Similar circumstances were present and the cops walked on the state charges. Next thing we knew, South Central LA was on fire. I fear that the same thing will happen in NO if the cops walk on this.
Big_Bear_Scot

How historically deficient are you? Remember the LA Riots of 1992? Similar circumstances were present and the cops walked on the state charges. Next thing we knew, South Central LA was on fire. I fear that the same thing will happen in NO if the cops walk on this.

 
 I am not American for one also I am sure you don't really know any of the recent History of my Country.
 
 I don't know the exact circumstances of the L.A riots, but what are the indicators that a similar thing may happen ?
 
 The only thing that is similar so far is that Cops have just beaten someone on the street and the act was caught on camera.
Bassman

Well, I do know the exact circumstances. And where were Jesse Jackson, Al Sharpton and the rest of the so-called "leadership?" They, as usual, played the race card and blamed it all on the white man. And I witnessed all of this unfold and, needless to say, I was thoroughly disgusted at the sight.
sanguinekane

Actually, the riots in LA in 1992 were only partly caused by the Rodney King beating. The major contributing factors were the neglect the city of LA was paying to the major economically depressed areas where the majority of residents were blacks or other minorities, as well as the near constant raids of black apartments on flimsy or made up evidence that had been hapening for months before the riots. The LAPD was called an occupation force, and they were certainly acting like one, constantly using excessive force and only protecting those whom they deemed worthy of protection. Rodney King's beating was just the straw that broke the camel's back.
Bassman
No riot is justifiable, and I think we'll see the same thing happen in NO.
sanguinekane
Well, that would be a point you and I are just going to have to disagree on I guess.
Bassman
What? That there should be rioting? or that it won't happen in NO.
Bell

From http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2001_Cincinnati_Riots
 
 
Downtown Cincinnati, Ohio experienced the worst rioting (often referred to as revolts or an uprising by supporters and sympathizers) from April 10, 2001 through April 12, 2001 since the 1960's. It was an unorganized and violent reaction to the fatal shooting of a 19-year-old black male, Timothy Thomas, by a white police officer, Stephen Roach, at 2:20 AM on April 7, 2001 during an on-foot pursuit by several officers.

 
 Also,
 
 http://www.cnn.com/2003/US/Midwest/12/01/died.in.custody/
 
 
CINCINNATI, Ohio (CNN) -- 2003 A 350-pound [black] man who died after being beaten by [white] police when they tried to subdue him had an enlarged heart, and cocaine and PCP in his system, the Hamilton County coroner's office said Monday. 
 There's a vid of this and it's pretty extreme. They are really beating on him and he's just laying on the ground with handcuffs on. Police should learn martial arts and the nonviolent ways of subduing people.

 I remember the LA riots but I could not remember the specifics, and if I was really interested I would probably do some kind of research. 
 
 I was willing to give Bassman some slack, I did not like the tone of his post in response to me but I have been brought up with some manners and did not feel like getting into a slagging match.
 
 The intent of the Orignal Poster seems to infer that the blacks in New Orleans will riot if these police officers get 'away with it', and he mentioned that there are some parallels with New Orleans at the moment too LA in the early 90s. 
 
 He has made the assertion and he should be able to back it up, that is why I replied to his post to see if he would back up his statements in order to foster the atmosphere that is conducive for a good debate. Until that time I have nothing further to add to this thread.
 
 BTW Clive, I was 12 :)
